p:
As is evident from the plethora of scientific and medical publications that are arising for COVID‐19, approaches to the detection, disease management, and prevention were very much dependent on lessons learned from the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) epidemics.
6 ,
7 The spread of SARS seems to have been terminated during 1 year, while MERS infections continued over a much longer period and are yet of lingering concern for relapse. The latter gives credence to the fact that, while there may be commonalities which suffice to assist us in these regards, there are nevertheless some virus‐virus distinctions which must be considered.
